alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 4:15PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Walla Walla County through 445 PM PDT... At 415 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Dixie, or 12 miles east of Walla Walla, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walla Walla, College Place, Dixie, Garrett and Kooskooskie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains
